summary.span: 表示一个双精度浮点数。

span.span: Represents a double-precision floating-point number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 值类型值介于负 1.79769313486232 e 308 到正 1.79769313486232 e 308，以及正或负零，表示一个双精度 64 位数字， ，并不是数字 ().The value type represents a double-precision 64-bit number with values ranging from negative 1.79769313486232e308 to positive 1.79769313486232e308, as well as positive or negative zero, , , and not a number (). 它旨在表示，可以非常大 （如行星或星系之间的距离） 或极小 （一种材料千克分子质量） 且通常处于 （如地球到距离另一个太阳系），不精确的值类型符合 IEC 60559: 1989 (IEEE 754) 二进制浮点算术标准。It is intended to represent values that are extremely large (such as distances between planets or galaxies) or extremely small (the molecular mass of a substance in kilograms) and that often are imprecise (such as the distance from earth to another solar system), The type complies with the IEC 60559:1989 (IEEE 754) standard for binary floating-point arithmetic. 本主题包括以下各节：This topic consists of the following sections: - [浮点表示形式和精度Floating-point representation and precision](#Precision) - [相等性测试Testing for equality](#Equality) - [浮点值和异常Floating-point values and exceptions](#Exceptions) - [类型转换和 Double 结构Type conversions and the Double structure](#Conversions) - [浮点功能Floating-point functionality](#Functionality) ## 浮点表示形式和精度Floating-Point Representation and Precision 数据类型将双精度浮点值存储在 64 位的二进制格式下, 表中所示：The data type stores double-precision floating-point values in a 64-bit binary format, as shown in the following table: |部件Part|位Bits| |----------|----------| |有效数或尾数Significand or mantissa|0-510-51| |指数Exponent|52-6252-62| |登录 (0 = 正数、 1 = 负)Sign (0 = Positive, 1 = Negative)|6363| 就像小数部分不能精确表示某些小数部分的值 (如 1/3 或)，二进制分数 （竖式） 不能表示某些小数部分值。Just as decimal fractions are unable to precisely represent some fractional values (such as 1/3 or ), binary fractions are unable to represent some fractional values. 例如，1/10，表示通过以小数值的.1 精确地，由为二进制分数，具有模式"0011"重复向无穷远的.001100110011 表示。For example, 1/10, which is represented precisely by .1 as a decimal fraction, is represented by .001100110011 as a binary fraction, with the pattern "0011" repeating to infinity. 在这种情况下，浮点值提供一个数字，它表示的不精确表示。In this case, the floating-point value provides an imprecise representation of the number that it represents. 通常执行其他数学运算上的原始的浮点值往往会增加其缺乏精度。Performing additional mathematical operations on the original floating-point value often tends to increase its lack of precision. 例如，如果我们比较相乘.1 通过 10 的结果，并添加.1 到.1 9 次，我们看到这种添加，因为它涉及到八个更多操作，请生成不太精确的结果。For example, if we compare the result of multiplying .1 by 10 and adding .1 to .1 nine times, we see that addition, because it has involved eight more operations, has produced the less precise result. 请注意，这种不一致是仅当我们显示两个明显值通过使用"R"[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，后者如果需要显示所有 17 位精度支持类型。Note that this disparity is apparent only if we display the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), which if necessary displays all 17 digits of precision supported by the type. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation1.vb#3)] 一些数字，不能精确表示为小数部分组成的二进制值，因为浮点数可以只是近似的实际数量。Because some numbers cannot be represented exactly as fractional binary values, floating-point numbers can only approximate real numbers. 所有的浮点数还具有有限的数量的有效位数，同时还确定浮点值如何准确地模拟实际数目。All floating-point numbers also have a limited number of significant digits, which also determines how accurately a floating-point value approximates a real number. A值具有最多 15 个小数位数的精度，尽管它在内部维护最大 17 位。A value has up to 15 decimal digits of precision, although a maximum of 17 digits is maintained internally. 这意味着某些浮点运算可能缺少精度若要更改的浮点值。This means that some floating-point operations may lack the precision to change a floating point value. 下面的示例进行了这方面的演示。The following example provides an illustration. 它定义一个非常大的浮点值，然后将添加的产品和一个 quadrillion 到它。It defines a very large floating-point value, and then adds the product of and one quadrillion to it. 该产品，但是，是太小，无法修改原始的浮点值。The product, however, is too small to modify the original floating-point value. 其最低有效位数是千分位，而在产品中的最高有效位是 1-312。Its least significant digit is thousandths, whereas the most significant digit in the product is 1-312. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation2.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation2.vb#4)] 有限的精度的浮点数的有几个结果：The limited precision of a floating-point number has several consequences: - 两个似乎相等的特定精度的浮点数可能不相等的因为其最低有效位数不同。Two floating-point numbers that appear equal for a particular precision might not compare equal because their least significant digits are different. 在下面的示例中，一系列数字加在一起，并具有其预期的总比较其总量。In the following example, a series of numbers are added together, and their total is compared with their expected total. 尽管两个值看起来相同，调用`Equals`方法表示它们不是。Although the two values appear to be the same, a call to the `Equals` method indicates that they are not. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist3.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist3.vb#6)] 如果更改中的格式项语句从`{0}`和`{1}`到`{0:R}`和`{1:R}`以显示两个的全部有效数字很明显的两个值相等的值，因为在添加操作期间的精度的损失。If you change the format items in the statement from `{0}` and `{1}` to `{0:R}` and `{1:R}` to display all significant digits of the two values, it is clear that the two values are unequal because of a loss of precision during the addition operations. 在这种情况下，通过调用来解决此问题方法要舍入到所需精度之前执行比较的值。In this case, the issue can be resolved by calling the method to round the values to the desired precision before performing the comparison. - 使用浮点数的数学或比较操作可能不生成相同的结果如果使用十进制数，因为二进制浮点数可能不等于的十进制数。A mathematical or comparison operation that uses a floating-point number might not yield the same result if a decimal number is used, because the binary floating-point number might not equal the decimal number. 前面的示例所示这显示相乘.1 通过 10 和添加.1 时间的结果。A previous example illustrated this by displaying the result of multiplying .1 by 10 and adding .1 times. 重要中带小数值的数字运算的准确性时，你可以使用而不是类型。When accuracy in numeric operations with fractional values is important, you can use the rather than the type. 当在使用的范围以外的整数值的数值运算中的准确性或类型是重要的是，使用类型。When accuracy in numeric operations with integral values beyond the range of the or types is important, use the type. - 一个值可能不往返，如果涉及到浮点数。A value might not round-trip if a floating-point number is involved. 一个值是指保存/还原，如果运算将原始的浮点数转换为另一个窗体、 反向操作可转换回浮点数，转换后的形式并最终的浮点数不等于原始浮点数。A value is said to round-trip if an operation converts an original floating-point number to another form, an inverse operation transforms the converted form back to a floating-point number, and the final floating-point number is not equal to the original floating-point number. 往返行程可能会失败，因为一个或多个最低有效位数丢失或更改在转换中。The round trip might fail because one or more least significant digits are lost or changed in a conversion. 在下面的示例中，三个值转换为字符串并保存在文件中。In the following example, three values are converted to strings and saved in a file. 如输出所示，但是，即使值似乎是相同的则还原的值不等于原始值。As the output shows, however, even though the values appear to be identical, the restored values are not equal to the original values. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist4.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist4.vb#7)] 在这种情况下，这些值可以为成功往返过程通过使用"G17"[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)若要保留完整的精度值，如以下示例所示。In this case, the values can be successfully round-tripped by using the "G17" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) to preserve the full precision of values, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist5.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist5.vb#8)] > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果用于失败以成功往返原始值的值，在某些情况下使用"R"格式说明符。When used with a value, the "R" format specifier in some cases fails to successfully round-trip the original value. 若要确保值成功往返，使用"G17"格式说明符。To ensure that values successfully round-trip, use the "G17" format specifier. - 值具有比精度降低值。 values have less precision than values. A值转换为看似等效通常不等于由于精度的差异值。A value that is converted to a seemingly equivalent often does not equal the value because of differences in precision. 在下面的示例中，相同的除法运算的结果赋给和值。In the following example, the result of identical division operations is assigned to a and a value. 后值被强制转换为，两个值的比较显示，它们不相等。After the value is cast to a , a comparison of the two values shows that they are unequal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/precisionlist1.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/precisionlist1.vb#5)] 若要避免此问题，使用代替了数据类型或使用方法，以便这两个值具有相同的精度。To avoid this problem, use either the in place of the data type, or use the method so that both values have the same precision. 此外，算术运算符和赋值操作的结果值可能略有不同的平台的精度丢失由于类型。In addition, the result of arithmetic and assignment operations with values may differ slightly by platform because of the loss of precision of the type. 例如，分配文本的结果值在.NET Framework 的 32 位和 64 位版本中可能不同。For example, the result of assigning a literal value may differ in the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of the .NET Framework. 下面的示例阐释了这一点差异时文字值-4.42330604244772 e-305 和其值为-4.42330604244772 e 变量-305 分配给变量。The following example illustrates this difference when the literal value -4.42330604244772E-305 and a variable whose value is -4.42330604244772E-305 are assigned to a variable. 请注意的结果方法在此情况下不会受到精度损失。Note that the result of the method in this case does not suffer from a loss of precision. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Class.Precision#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.class.precision/cs/precision1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Class.Precision#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.class.precision/vb/precision1.vb#1)] ## 相等性测试Testing for Equality 将被视为相等，两个值必须表示相同的值。To be considered equal, two values must represent identical values. 但是，由于的精度值，之间的差异或由于一个或两个值的精度损失，预计通常会相同的浮点值打开要由于其最低有效位的差异不相等。However, because of differences in precision between values, or because of a loss of precision by one or both values, floating-point values that are expected to be identical often turn out to be unequal because of differences in their least significant digits. 因此，调用方法来确定两个值是否相等或对的调用方法来确定两个之间的关系值，通常会产生意外的结果。As a result, calls to the method to determine whether two values are equal, or calls to the method to determine the relationship between two values, often yield unexpected results. 这是很明显的以下示例中，其中两个显然是等于值变得不相等，因为需要第一个具有 15 位精度，而第二个具有 17。This is evident in the following example, where two apparently equal values turn out to be unequal because the first has 15 digits of precision, while the second has 17. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison1.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison1.vb#9)] 计算的值，请按照不同的代码路径和的操作的不同的方式通常证明是不相等。Calculated values that follow different code paths and that are manipulated in different ways often prove to be unequal. 在下面的示例中，一个值平方值，且然后计算平方根还原原始值。In the following example, one value is squared, and then the square root is calculated to restore the original value. 第二个乘以 3.51 和平方值之前的结果的平方根除以 3.51 还原原始值。A second is multiplied by 3.51 and squared before the square root of the result is divided by 3.51 to restore the original value. 尽管两个值似乎是相同的但调用方法指示它们是否不相等。Although the two values appear to be identical, a call to the method indicates that they are not equal. 使用"R"标准格式字符串返回显示的每个双精度值的所有有效位的结果字符串显示第二个值是.0000000000001 小于第一个。Using the "R" standard format string to return a result string that displays all the significant digits of each Double value shows that the second value is .0000000000001 less than the first. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison2.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison2.vb#10)] 在其中发生精度损失是可能会影响比较的结果的情况下，您可以采用以下备选方案于调用的任何或方法：In cases where a loss of precision is likely to affect the result of a comparison, you can adopt any of the following alternatives to calling the or method: - 调用方法，以确保这两个值具有相同的精度。Call the method to ensure that both values have the same precision. 下面的示例修改了前面的示例以使用此方法，以便两个小数部分的值相等。The following example modifies a previous example to use this approach so that two fractional values are equivalent. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison3.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison3.vb#11)] 但请注意，精度问题，仍适用于的中点值舍入。Note, though, that the problem of precision still applies to rounding of midpoint values. 有关更多信息，请参见 方法。For more information, see the method. - 大致相等性测试而不是相等。Test for approximate equality rather than equality. 这要求你定义任一绝对量所依据的两个值可以与不同，但仍要相等，或你定义所依据的较小值可以分离从更大的值相对量。This requires that you define either an absolute amount by which the two values can differ but still be equal, or that you define a relative amount by which the smaller value can diverge from the larger value. > [!WARNING] > 有时使用作为两个之间的距离的绝对度量值时测试是否相等。 is sometimes used as an absolute measure of the distance between two values when testing for equality. 但是，测量的最小可能值，可以添加到，或相减，其值为零。However, measures the smallest possible value that can be added to, or subtracted from, a whose value is zero. 对于大多数正和负值、 的值太小以致无法检测到。For most positive and negative values, the value of is too small to be detected. 因此，除了均为零的值，不建议在相等的测试中使用它。Therefore, except for values that are zero, we do not recommend its use in tests for equality. 下面的示例使用后一种方法来定义`IsApproximatelyEqual`测试两个值之间的相对差异的方法。The following example uses the latter approach to define an `IsApproximatelyEqual` method that tests the relative difference between two values. 它还将对的调用的结果进行比较`IsApproximatelyEqual`方法和方法。It also contrasts the result of calls to the `IsApproximatelyEqual` method and the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/comparison4.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/comparison4.vb#12)] ## 浮点值和异常Floating-Point Values and Exceptions 与整数类型，会被零中的溢出或非法操作，如除法的情况下引发异常，操作不同具有浮点值的操作不会引发异常。Unlike operations with integral types, which throw exceptions in cases of overflow or illegal operations such as division by zero, operations with floating-point values do not throw exceptions. 相反，在异常的情况下，浮点运算的结果为零、 正无穷大、 负无穷大或非数值 (NaN):Instead, in exceptional situations, the result of a floating-point operation is zero, positive infinity, negative infinity, or not a number (NaN): - 如果浮点运算的结果太小，目标格式，则结果为零。If the result of a floating-point operation is too small for the destination format, the result is zero. 这会非常小的两个数字相乘，如以下示例所示时发生。This can occur when two very small numbers are multiplied, as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/exceptional1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/exceptional1.vb#1)] - 如果浮点运算的结果的大小超出目标格式的范围，该操作的结果是或以适合结果的符号。If the magnitude of the result of a floating-point operation exceeds the range of the destination format, the result of the operation is or , as appropriate for the sign of the result. 溢出操作的结果是，和溢出操作的结果是，如下面的示例所示。The result of an operation that overflows is , and the result of an operation that overflows is , as the following example shows. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/exceptional2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/exceptional2.vb#2)] 也通过零正被除数，可能会造成一个除法运算和负被除数的零的除法运算的结果。 also results from a division by zero with a positive dividend, and results from a division by zero with a negative dividend. - 如果浮点运算无效，该操作的结果是。If a floating-point operation is invalid, the result of the operation is . 例如，结果从以下操作：For example, results from the following operations: - 被零除与被除数为零。Division by zero with a dividend of zero. 注意除法运算的其他情况下由零个结果中任意一种或。Note that other cases of division by zero result in either or . - 通过无效输入任何浮点运算。Any floating-point operation with an invalid input. 例如，调用一个含有负值的方法返回、 一样调用具有值大于 1 或更少负一方法。For example, calling the method with a negative value returns , as does calling the method with a value that is greater than one or less than negative one. - 其值的参数与任何操作。Any operation with an argument whose value is . ## 类型转换和 Double 结构Type conversions and the Double structure 结构未定义任何显式或隐式转换运算符; 相反，由编译器实现转换。The structure does not define any explicit or implicit conversion operators; instead, conversions are implemented by the compiler. 转换到任何基元数值类型的值扩大转换并因此不需要显式强制转换运算符，也没有除非编译器显式要求调用转换方法。The conversion of the value of any primitive numeric type to a is a widening conversion and therefore does not require an explicit cast operator or call to a conversion method unless a compiler explicitly requires it. 例如，C# 编译器需要强制转换运算符的转换从到，而 Visual Basic 编译器不。For example, the C# compiler requires a casting operator for conversions from to , while the Visual Basic compiler does not. 以下示例将转换到其他基元数值类型的最小值或最大值。The following example converts the minimum or maximum value of other primitive numeric types to a . [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#20](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/convert1.cs#20)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#20](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/convert1.vb#20)] 此外，值， ，和隐蔽到， ，和分别。In addition, the values , , and covert to , , and , respectively. 请注意，转换到某些数值类型的值值可能涉及精度损失。Note that the conversion of the value of some numeric types to a value can involve a loss of precision. 如示例所示，转换时，是可能发生精度损失， ， ，和值复制到值。As the example illustrates, a loss of precision is possible when converting , , , and values to values. 转换值转换为其他任何基元数值数据类型的值都是收缩转换并不需要转换运算符 （在 C# 中)、 转换方法 （在 Visual Basic 中) 或调用方法。The conversion of a value to a value of any other primitive numeric data type is a narrowing conversion and requires a cast operator (in C#), a conversion method (in Visual Basic), or a call to a method. 范围外的目标数据类型，这由目标类型定义的值`MinValue`和`MaxValue`属性下, 表中所示的行为。Values that are outside the range of the target data type, which are defined by the target type's `MinValue` and `MaxValue` properties, behave as shown in the following table. |目标类型Target type|结果Result| |-----------------|------------| |任何整数类型Any integral type|异常，则转换发生在检查的上下文。An exception if the conversion occurs in a checked context.

如果转换发生在 unchecked 上下文 （C# 中默认值），转换操作成功，但值溢出。If the conversion occurs in an unchecked context (the default in C#), the conversion operation succeeds but the value overflows.| ||一个 异常。An exception.| || 负值。 for negative values.

对于正值。 for positive values.| 此外， ， ，和引发转换为在 checked 的上下文中，但这些值溢出时转换为未选中的上下文内的整数的整数。In addition, , , and throw an for conversions to integers in a checked context, but these values overflow when converted to integers in an unchecked context. 转换到，它们总是引发。For conversions to , they always throw an . 转换到，它们转换为， ，和分别。For conversions to , they convert to , , and , respectively. 请注意，精度损失可能造成从转换到另一种数值类型的值。Note that a loss of precision may result from converting a value to another numeric type. 在将非整型的转换的情况下值，如示例输出所示，小数部分时丢失值舍入 （如 Visual Basic 中)，或者截断 （如 C# 中)。In the case of converting non-integral values, as the output from the example shows, the fractional component is lost when the value is either rounded (as in Visual Basic) or truncated (as in C#). 转换到和值，值中的目标数据类型不能有精确的表示形式。For conversions to and values, the value may not have a precise representation in the target data type. 以下示例将转换的数字到几个其他数值类型的值。The following example converts a number of values to several other numeric types. 转换发生在 checked 上下文中在 Visual Basic （默认值） 和 C# 中 (由于[检查](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/checked.md)关键字)。The conversions occur in a checked context in Visual Basic (the default) and in C# (because of the [checked](~/docs/csharp/language-reference/keywords/checked.md) keyword). 示例输出显示转换的结果中这两个检查未选中的上下文。The output from the example shows the result for conversions in both a checked an unchecked context. 可以在 Visual Basic 中未选中的上下文中执行转换，通过使用编译`/removeintchecks+`编译器开关和 C# 通过注释掉`checked`语句。You can perform conversions in an unchecked context in Visual Basic by compiling with the `/removeintchecks+` compiler switch and in C# by commenting out the `checked` statement. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#21](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/convert2.cs#21)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/convert2.vb#21)] 数值类型的转换的详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的类型转换](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md)和[类型转换表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)。For more information on the conversion of numeric types, see [Type Conversion in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md) and [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md). ## 浮点功能Floating-Point Functionality 结构和相关的类型提供以下区域中执行操作的方法：The structure and related types provide methods to perform operations in the following areas: - **值比较**。**Comparison of values**. 你可以调用方法来确定是否两个值是否相等，则方法来确定两个值之间的关系。You can call the method to determine whether two values are equal, or the method to determine the relationship between two values. 结构还支持一组完整的比较运算符。The structure also supports a complete set of comparison operators. 例如，你可以测试相等，或确定一个值是否大于或等于另一个。For example, you can test for equality or inequality, or determine whether one value is greater than or equal to another. 如果其中一个操作数是数值类型，而不，它将转换为之前执行比较。If one of the operands is a numeric type other than a , it is converted to a before performing the comparison. > [!WARNING] > 由于的精度，差异两个应相等的值可能会发现不相等，这会影响比较的结果。Because of differences in precision, two values that you expect to be equal may turn out to be unequal, which affects the result of the comparison. 请参阅[相等性测试](#Equality)比较两个有关详细信息的部分值。See the [Testing for Equality](#Equality) section for more information about comparing two values. 你还可以调用， ， ，和方法来测试这些特殊值。You can also call the , , , and methods to test for these special values. - **数学运算**。**Mathematical operations**. 按语言编译器和公共中间语言 (CIL) 的说明，而不是实现常见的算术运算，例如加法、 减法、 乘法和除法，方法。Common arithmetic operations, such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, are implemented by language compilers and Common Intermediate Language (CIL) instructions, rather than by methods. 如果一个中的数学运算的操作数是数值类型，而不，它将转换为之前执行该操作。If one of the operands in a mathematical operation is a numeric type other than a , it is converted to a before performing the operation. 操作的结果也是值。The result of the operation is also a value. 可以通过调用执行其他数学运算`static`(`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中) 中的方法类。Other mathematical operations can be performed by calling `static` (`Shared` in Visual Basic) methods in the class. 它包括常用于算术的其他方法 (如， ，和)，geometry (如和)，和微积分 (如)。It includes additional methods commonly used for arithmetic (such as , , and ), geometry (such as and ), and calculus (such as ). 您还可以操作中的单个位值。You can also manipulate the individual bits in a value. 方法保留值的位模式在 64 位整数。The method preserves a value's bit pattern in a 64-bit integer. 方法返回其位模式中的字节数组。The method returns its bit pattern in a byte array. - **舍入**。**Rounding**. 舍入通常用作一种技术来减少引起问题的浮点表示形式和精度值之间的差异的影响。Rounding is often used as a technique for reducing the impact of differences between values caused by problems of floating-point representation and precision. 您可以舍入值通过调用方法。You can round a value by calling the method. - **格式设置**。**Formatting**. 你可以将转换为通过调用其字符串表示形式的值方法或通过使用复合格式设置功能。You can convert a value to its string representation by calling the method or by using the composite formatting feature. 有关如何格式字符串控制浮点值的字符串表示的信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)主题。For information about how format strings control the string representation of floating-point values, see the [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md) topics. - **分析字符串**。**Parsing strings**. 你可以将转换为浮点值的字符串表示值通过调用或方法。You can convert the string representation of a floating-point value to a value by calling either the or method. 如果分析操作失败，方法引发异常，而方法返回`false`。If the parse operation fails, the method throws an exception, whereas the method returns `false`. - **类型转换**。**Type conversion**. 结构可提供的显式接口实现接口，支持任何两个的标准.NET Framework 数据类型之间的转换。The structure provides an explicit interface implementation for the interface, which supports conversion between any two standard .NET Framework data types. 语言编译器还支持的所有其他标准数值类型为值的隐式转换值。Language compilers also support the implicit conversion of values of all other standard numeric types to values. 到任何标准数值类型的值转换的扩大转换和不需要的强制转换运算符或转换方法，用户Conversion of a value of any standard numeric type to a is a widening conversion and does not require the user of a casting operator or conversion method, 但是，转换和值可能涉及精度损失。However, conversion of and values can involve a loss of precision. 下表列出了有关上述每种类型的精度的差异：The following table lists the differences in precision for each of these types: |类型Type|最大精度Maximum precision|内部精度Internal precision| |----------|-----------------------|------------------------| ||1515|1717| ||19 的十进制数字19 decimal digits|19 的十进制数字19 decimal digits| ||7 个小数位7 decimal digits|9 的十进制数字9 decimal digits| 精度问题最常影响值转换为值。The problem of precision most frequently affects values that are converted to values. 在下面的示例中，由相同的除法运算的两个值是否不相等的值之一是单精度浮点值转换为。In the following example, two values produced by identical division operations are unequal because one of the values is a single-precision floating point value converted to a . [!code-csharp[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/cs/representation1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Structure#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.structure/vb/representation1.vb#3)] ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用:The following code example illustrates the use of : [!code-cpp[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Double Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Double Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值必须完全相同，将被视为相等。Values must be identical to be considered equal. 尤其是当浮点值依赖于多个数学运算，它是一种常见的他们丢失精度输入其值是除其最低有效位数几乎完全相同。Particularly when floating-point values depend on multiple mathematical operations, it is common for them to lose precision and for their values to be nearly identical except for their least significant digits. 因此，返回值的方法有时看上去可能令人惊讶。Because of this, the return value of the method at times may seem surprising. 例如，通过同样的值跟除法的特定值的乘法应生成原始值。For example, multiplication by a particular value followed by division by the same value should produce the original value. 在下面的示例中，但是，计算的值被证明大于原始值。In the following example, however, the computed value turns out to be greater than the original value. 通过使用"R"显示两个值的所有有效位数[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)指示该计算的值不同于其最低有效位数中的原始值。Showing all significant digits of the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) indicates that the computed value differs from the original value in its least significant digits. 有关处理这种比较的信息，请参阅的备注部分方法。For information on handling such comparisons, see the Remarks section of the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.CompareTo#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/cs/compareto2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.CompareTo#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.compareto/vb/compareto2.vb#1)] 此方法实现接口，并且执行效果略好于方法因为它不具有要转换`value`对对象的参数。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 请注意，虽然一个对象，其值是不被视为等于另一个对象，其值是（即使是其自身），接口也要求`A.CompareTo(A)`返回零。Note that, although an object whose value is is not considered equal to another object whose value is (even itself), the interface requires that `A.CompareTo(A)` return zero. ## 扩大转换Widening Conversions 具体取决于您的编程语言，它可能会对代码其中的参数类型具有较少的位的方法 （为较窄） 比实例类型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 这可能是因为某些编程语言中执行的隐式的扩大转换，它表示具有任意数量的位的实例作为类型参数。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假设实例类型是和参数类型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 编译器生成的指令来表示形式的参数值对象，然后生成比较实例的值和参数的扩大的表示的方法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as a object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the widened representation of the parameter. 咨询你的编程语言的文档，以确定其编译器是否执行数值类型的隐式扩大转换。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions of numeric types. 有关详细信息，请参阅[类型转换表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)主题。For more information, see the [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md) topic. ## 在比较中的精度Precision in Comparisons 超出有案可稽的精度的浮点数的精度是特定于实现和.NET Framework 版本。The precision of floating-point numbers beyond the documented precision is specific to the implementation and version of the .NET Framework. 因此，两个特定的数字的比较可能会更改.NET Framework 各版本之间因为精度的数字的内部表示形式可能会更改。Consequently, a comparison of two particular numbers might change between versions of the .NET Framework because the precision of the numbers' internal representation might change. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示泛型和非泛型版本的多个值和引用类型的方法。The following code example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. remarks.format: ## Remarks `value`参数必须是`null`或实例`Double`; 否则为将引发异常。The `value` parameter must be `null` or an instance of `Double`; otherwise, an exception is thrown. 任何实例，无论其值被视为大于`null`。Any instance of , regardless of its value, is considered greater than `null`. 值必须完全相同，将被视为相等。Values must be identical to be considered equal. 尤其是当浮点值依赖于多个数学运算，它是一种常见的他们丢失精度输入其值是除其最低有效位数几乎完全相同。Particularly when floating-point values depend on multiple mathematical operations, it is common for them to lose precision and for their values to be nearly identical except for their least significant digits. 因此，返回值的方法有时看上去可能令人惊讶。Because of this, the return value of the method at times may seem surprising. 例如，通过同样的值跟除法的特定值的乘法应生成原始值。For example, multiplication by a particular value followed by division by the same value should produce the original value. 在下面的示例中，但是，计算的值被证明大于原始值。In the following example, however, the computed value turns out to be greater than the original value. 通过使用"R"显示两个值的所有有效位数[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)指示该计算的值不同于其最低有效位数中的原始值。Showing all significant digits of the two values by using the "R" [standard numeric format string](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) indicates that the computed value differs from the original value in its least significant digits. 有关处理这种比较的信息，请参阅的备注部分方法。For information on handling such comparisons, see the Remarks section of the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 值属性反映的最小正很重要数字的操作或比较的值时的值实例为零。The value of the property reflects the smallest positive value that is significant in numeric operations or comparisons when the value of the instance is zero. 例如，以下代码所示，零和被视为不相等的值，而零和一半的值被视为相等。For example, the following code shows that zero and are considered to be unequal values, whereas zero and half the value of are considered to be equal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/epsilon.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/epsilon.vb#5)] 更确切地说，浮点格式由登录、 一个 52 位尾数或有效数，以及一个 11 位指数的点。More precisely, the floating point format consists of a sign, a 52-bit mantissa or significand, and an 11-bit exponent. 如下面的示例所示，零将具有-1022年指数和尾数的 0。As the following example shows, zero has an exponent of -1022 and a mantissa of 0. 具有-1022年指数和尾数的 1。 has an exponent of -1022 and a mantissa of 1. 这意味着，是最小正值大于零，表示最小可能值和最小可能增加其指数是-1022年。This means that is the smallest positive value greater than zero and represents the smallest possible value and the smallest possible increment for a whose exponent is -1022. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/epsilon1.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/epsilon1.vb#6)] 但是，属性不是常规度量值的精度键入; 它仅适用于具有的值为 0 或-1022年的指数的实例。However, the property is not a general measure of precision of the type; it applies only to instances that have a value of zero or an exponent of -1022. > [!NOTE] > 值属性不是等效于计算机 epsilon，表示相对的错误，因为浮点算术舍入的上限。The value of the property is not equivalent to machine epsilon, which represents the upper bound of the relative error due to rounding in floating-point arithmetic. 此常量的值是 4.94065645841247 e-324。The value of this constant is 4.94065645841247e-324. 两个显然是等效的浮点数的比较结果可能会为不相等，由于其最低有效位的差异。Two apparently equivalent floating-point numbers might not compare equal because of differences in their least significant digits. 例如，C# 表达式`(double)1/3 == (double)0.33333`，不比较相等的因为在左侧的除法运算具有最大精度，而右侧常量是仅精确到指定的位数。For example, the C# expression, `(double)1/3 == (double)0.33333`, does not compare equal because the division operation on the left side has maximum precision while the constant on the right side is precise only to the specified digits. 如果创建自定义算法来确定是否可视为两个浮点数相等时，我们不建议的值基于您的算法要建立不同之处的可接受绝对边距常量要被视为相等的两个值。If you create a custom algorithm that determines whether two floating-point numbers can be considered equal, we do not recommend that you base your algorithm on the value of the constant to establish the acceptable absolute margin of difference for the two values to be considered equal. (通常情况下，相应的边距的差异大于多次。)有关比较两个双精度浮点值的信息，请参阅和。(Typically, that margin of difference is many times greater than .) For information about comparing two double-precision floating-point values, see and . ## 平台说明Platform Notes ARM 系统的值上常量是太小以致无法检测到，因此它相当于零。On ARM systems, the value of the constant is too small to be detected, so it equates to zero. 你可以定义可选 epsilon 值等于 2.2250738585072014 e-308 相反。You can define an alternative epsilon value that equals 2.2250738585072014E-308 instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法实现接口，并且执行效果略好于因为它不具有要转换`obj`对对象的参数。This method implements the interface, and performs slightly better than because it does not have to convert the `obj` parameter to an object. ## 扩大转换Widening Conversions 具体取决于您的编程语言，它可能会对代码其中的参数类型具有较少的位的方法 （为较窄） 比实例类型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 这可能是因为某些编程语言中执行的隐式的扩大转换，它表示具有任意数量的位的实例作为类型参数。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假设实例类型是和参数类型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 编译器生成的指令来表示形式的参数值对象，然后生成比较实例的值和参数的扩大的表示的方法。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as a object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the widened representation of the parameter. 咨询你的编程语言的文档，以确定其编译器是否执行数值类型的隐式扩大转换。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine if its compiler performs implicit widening conversions of numeric types. 有关详细信息，请参阅[类型转换表](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md)主题。For more information, see the [Type Conversion Tables](~/docs/standard/base-types/conversion-tables.md) topic. ## 在比较中的精度Precision in Comparisons 方法应多加小心，因为两个显然相等的值可能会由于不同的两个值的精度不相等。The method should be used with caution, because two apparently equivalent values can be unequal due to the differing precision of the two values. 下面的示例报告值.333333 和1 除以 3 返回值不相等。The following example reports that the value .333333 and the value returned by dividing 1 by 3 are unequal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/Equals_25051.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/Equals_25051.vb#1)] 而不是比较是否相等，一种方法涉及定义两个值之间的差异可接受相对范围 (如。 001%的值之一)。Rather than comparing for equality, one technique involves defining an acceptable relative margin of difference between two values (such as .001% of one of the values). 如果两个值之间的差异的绝对值是小于或等于该边距，区别是可能是由于精度的不同，并因此的值很可能相等。If the absolute value of the difference between the two values is less than or equal to that margin, the difference is likely to be due to differences in precision and, therefore, the values are likely to be equal. 下面的示例使用此方法来比较.33333 和 1/3，这两个前面的代码示例找到要不相等的值。The following example uses this technique to compare .33333 and 1/3, the two values that the previous code example found to be unequal. 在这种情况下，值相等。In this case, the values are equal. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Epsilon#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/cs/Equals_25051.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Epsilon#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Epsilon/vb/Equals_25051.vb#2)] > [!NOTE] > 因为定义的最小的表达式必须大于两个类似的值之间的差异的边距其范围是接近于零的正值， 。Because defines the minimum expression of a positive value whose range is near zero, the margin of difference between two similar values must be greater than . 通常情况下，大于多次。Typically, it is many times greater than . 因此，我们建议你不要使用比较时值是否相等。Because of this, we recommend that you do not use when comparing values for equality. 第二种方法涉及比较两个浮点数与某些绝对值的数值之间的差异。A second technique involves comparing the difference between two floating-point numbers with some absolute value. 如果差异在于小于或等于该绝对值的数值，数字相等。If the difference is less than or equal to that absolute value, the numbers are equal. 如果较高，则数字不相等。If it is greater, the numbers are not equal. 一种替代方法是任意选择绝对值。One alternative is to arbitrarily select an absolute value. 这会产生问题，但是，因为差异可接受范围取决于的量值。This is problematic, however, because an acceptable margin of difference depends on the magnitude of the values. 第二个备选利用浮点格式的设计功能： 之间的整数表示两个浮点值形式的差异指示分隔这些数量的可能的浮点值。A second alternative takes advantage of a design feature of the floating-point format: The difference between the integer representation of two floating-point values indicates the number of possible floating-point values that separates them. 例如，0.0 之间的差异和为 1，因为使用时是可表示的最小值其值为零。For example, the difference between 0.0 and is 1, because is the smallest representable value when working with a whose value is zero. 下面的示例使用此方法来比较.33333 和 1/3，是这两个值与前面的代码示例方法找到要不相等。The following example uses this technique to compare .33333 and 1/3, which are the two values that the previous code example with the method found to be unequal. 请注意，该示例使用方法将一个双精度浮点值转换为其整数表示形式。Note that the example uses the method to convert a double-precision floating-point value to its integer representation. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/cs/equalsabs1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/vb/equalsabs1.vb#1)] 超出有案可稽的精度的浮点数的精度是特定于实现和.NET Framework 版本。The precision of floating-point numbers beyond the documented precision is specific to the implementation and version of the .NET Framework. 因此，两个特定的数字的比较可能会更改.NET Framework 各版本之间因为精度的数字的内部表示形式可能会更改。Consequently, a comparison of two particular numbers might change between versions of the .NET Framework because the precision of the numbers' internal representation might change. 如果两个值是否相等测试通过调用方法，该方法返回`true`。If two values are tested for equality by calling the method, the method returns `true`. 但是，如果两个值使用相等运算符测试是否相等，则该运算符将返回`false`。However, if two values are tested for equality by using the equality operator, the operator returns `false`. 如果想要确定是否的值不是一个数字 (NaN) 的替代方法是调用方法。When you want to determine whether the value of a is not a number (NaN), an alternative is to call the method.

span.para: 编译器重载决策可能应对明显的差异的两个行为方法重载。如果之间的隐式转换自变量和一个定义和自变量并不类型化为，编译器可能会执行隐式转换和调用方法。否则，它们调用方法，始终返回如果其参数不是值。下面的示例阐释了两个方法重载之间的行为差异。对于所有的基元数值类型，除和 C# 中的第一个比较返回因为编译器自动执行一个的扩大转换，调用方法，而第二个比较返回由于编译器调用方法。 [！ code-csharp[System.Double.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#2)][！ code-vb[System.Double.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#2)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers may perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of all primitive numeric types except for and in C#, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Equals#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.double.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`参数可以包含当前区域性的， ， ，或格式的字符串：The `s` parameter can contain the current culture's , , , or a string of the form: [*ws*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*sign*][*integral-digits*[*,*]]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空白字符。A series of white-space characters.| |*sign**sign*|负号符号 （-） 或正号符号 （+）。A negative sign symbol (-) or a positive sign symbol (+). 可以使用仅前导符号。Only a leading sign can be used.| |*整型数字**integral-digits*|一系列的范围从 0 到 9 的指定数的整数部分的数字。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 运行*整型数字*进行分区的组分隔符符号。Runs of *integral-digits* can be partitioned by a group-separator symbol. 例如，在某些区域性使用逗号 （，） 作为千位分隔符。For example, in some cultures a comma (,) separates groups of thousands. *整型数字*元素可以是缺少如果字符串包含*小数位数*元素。The *integral-digits* element can be absent if the string contains the *fractional-digits* element.| |,,|特定于区域性的千位分隔符符号。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |..|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列的范围从 0 到 9 的指定数的小数部分的数字。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字符，指示该值表示指数 （科学型） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation.| |*指数数字**exponential-digits*|一系列的范围从 0 到 9 的指定指数的位数。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| `s`参数被解释结合使用和标志。The `s` parameter is interpreted using a combination of the and flags. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符允许，例如，虽然并不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed, for example, while currency symbols are not. 更细致的控制元素中的样式的允许`s`分析操作成功，调用或方法。For finer control over which style elements are permitted in `s` for the parse operation to succeed, call the or the method. `s`参数被解释使用中的格式设置信息初始化当前线程区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current thread culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 若要分析使用的格式信息的一些其他区域性的字符串，调用或方法。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other culture, call the or method. 通常，如果你通过方法通过调用创建的字符串方法时，原始返回值。Ordinarily, if you pass the method a string that is created by calling the method, the original value is returned. 但是，由于精度损失，值可能不相等。However, because of a loss of precision, the values may not be equal. 此外，尝试分析的字符串表示形式是或引发，如下面的示例所示。In addition, attempting to parse the string representation of either or throws an , as the following example illustrates. [!code-csharp[System.Double.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Parse/cs/parse2.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.Parse#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.Parse/vb/parse2.vb#3)] 如果在遇到分隔符`s`期间执行分析操作，并适用的货币或小数位的参数和组分隔符相同，则分析操作假定该分隔符是小数分隔符，而不是一组分隔符。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 有关分隔符的详细信息，请参阅， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法的用法。The following example illustrates the use of the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载方法通常用于将可在多个方面与格式设置的文本转换值。This overload of the method is typically used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可以用于将转换输入的文本是由用户 HTML 文本框中为数值。For example, it can be used to convert the text that is entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s`参数被解释结合使用和标志。The `s` parameter is interpreted using a combination of the and flags. `s`参数可以包含， ，或为指定的区域性`provider`，也可以包含形式的字符串：The `s` parameter can contain , , or for the culture specified by `provider`, or it can contain a string of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*integral-digits*[*.*[*fractional-digits*]][E[*sign*]*exponential-digits*][*ws*] 可选元素括在方括号 symbol (+).| |*整型数字**integral-digits*|一系列的范围从 0 到 9 的指定数的整数部分的数字。A series of digits ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 运行*整型数字*进行分区的组分隔符符号。Runs of *integral-digits* can be partitioned by a group-separator symbol. 例如，在某些区域性使用逗号 （，） 作为千位分隔符。For example, in some cultures a comma (,) separates groups of thousands. *整型数字*元素可以是缺少如果字符串包含*小数位数*元素。The *integral-digits* element can be absent if the string contains the *fractional-digits* element.| |..|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列的范围从 0 到 9 summary.span: 将此实例的数值转换为其等效的字符串表示形式。

span.span: Converts the numeric value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.

returns.span: 此实例的值的字符串表示形式。

span.span: The string representation of the value of this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式默认值 （"G"或常规） 中的值的当前区域性的格式。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format of the current culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式、 精度或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format, precision, or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式或精度A specific format or precision|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式或精度A specific format or precision|特定区域性A specific culture|| 返回值可以是， ， ，或格式的字符串：The return value can be , , , or a string of the form: [sign]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][sign]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits] 可选元素括在方括号 （[和]）。Optional elements are framed in square brackets ([ and ]). 包含字词"数字"的元素包含的范围从 0 到 9 的数字字符序列。Elements that contain the term "digits" consist of a series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9. 支持下表中列出的元素。The elements listed in the following table are supported. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*sign**sign*|负号或正号符号。A negative sign or positive sign symbol.| |*整型数字**integral-digits*|一系列的指定数的整数部分的数字。A series of digits specifying the integral part of the number. 整型数字可以是 absent 是否存在小数位数。Integral-digits can be absent if there are fractional-digits.| |'*.*''*.*'|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|指定数字的小数部分位数一系列。A series of digits specifying the fractional part of the number.| |'*e*''*e*'|小写字符 e，该值指示指数 （科学型） 表示法。A lowercase character 'e', indicating exponential (scientific) notation.| |*指数数字**exponential-digits*|一系列的指定指数的位数。A series of digits specifying an exponent.| 返回值的一些示例为"100"、"-123456789"、"123.45 e + 6"、"500"、"3.1416"、"600"、"-0.123"和"-Infinity"。Some examples of the return value are "100", "-123,456,789", "123.45e+6", "500", "3.1416", "600", "-0.123", and "-Infinity". .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例使用默认值方法以显示的字符串表示形式的大量值。The following example uses the default method to display the string representations of a number of values. [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/ToString1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/ToString1.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示如何使用。The following example illustrates the use of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式通过使用当前区域性的约定指定的格式的值。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要指定其他文件格式或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式或精度A specific format or precision|特定区域性A specific culture|| 返回值可以是， ， ，或一个数字，按指定的字符串表示`format`。The return value can be , , , or the string representation of a number, as specified by `format`. `format`参数可以是任何有效的标准数字格式说明符 （D 和 X，除外） 以及自定义数字格式说明符的任意组合。The `format` parameter can be any valid standard numeric format specifier except for D and X, as well as any combination of custom numeric format specifiers. 如果`format`是`null`或空字符串，返回值格式与常规的数字格式说明符 ("G")。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value is formatted with the general numeric format specifier ("G"). .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 默认情况下，返回的值仅包含 15 位精度但内部维护最大 17 位。By default, the return value only contains 15 digits of precision although a maximum of 17 digits is maintained internally. 如果此实例的值大于 15 位，返回或而不是预期的版本号。If the value of this instance has greater than 15 digits, returns or instead of the expected number. 如果需要更高的精度，指定`format`使用"G17"格式规范中，始终返回 17 位精度或"R"，它返回 15 位如果可以用该精度或 17 位表示数，如果该数字仅可以是表示与最大精度。If you require more precision, specify `format` with the "G17" format specification, which always returns 17 digits of precision, or "R", which returns 15 digits if the number can be represented with that precision or 17 digits if the number can only be represented with maximum precision. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个数值，并将其格式化为货币值使用"C"标准数字格式字符串为三个小数位的数字值以及通过使用"N"标准数字格式字符串。The following example defines a numeric value and formats it as a currency value by using the "C" standard numeric format string and as a numeric value to three decimal places by using the "N" standard numeric format string. 结果字符串设置格式的使用 EN-US 区域性的约定。The result strings are formatted by using the conventions of the en-US culture. 数字格式字符串的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information on numeric format strings, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/ToString7.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/ToString7.vb#7)] 下面的示例显示几个值使用以及三个自定义数字格式字符串的支持标准数字格式说明符。The following example displays several values using the supported standard numeric format specifiers together with three custom numeric format strings. 这些自定义格式字符串中的一个演示如何以填充用前导零的值。One of those custom format strings illustrates how to pad a value with leading zeros. 此外，该示例使用"R"之外的每个标准格式说明符使用精度说明符。In addition, the example uses precision specifiers with each standard format specifier except for "R". 精度说明符的范围从 0 到 3 的值。The values of the precision specifiers range from 0 to 3. 若要将数字的值转换为字符串，该示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定。To convert the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. [!code-cpp[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cpp/tostring3.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/ToString1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/ToString1.vb#3)]

span.para: 在某些情况下，值使用"R"标准数字格式字符串格式化该值将无法成功往返如果编译使用或交换机和 64 位系统上运行。若要解决此问题，可以使用“G17”标准数字格式字符串格式化 值。下面的示例使用"R"格式字符串与值往返不成功，并还使用"G17"格式字符串以成功往返原始值。 [！ 代码 csharp [System.Double.ToString#6] (~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/系统。Double.ToString/cs/roundtripex2.cs#6)] [！ 代码 vb [System.Double.ToString#6] (~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/系统。Double.ToString/vb/roundtripex2.vb#6)]

In some cases, values formatted with the "R" standard numeric format string do not successfully round-trip if compiled using the or switches and run on 64-bit systems. To work around this problem, you can format values by using the "G17" standard numeric format string. The following example uses the "R" format string with a value that does not round-trip successfully, and also uses the "G17" format string to successfully round-trip the original value. [!code-csharp[System.Double.ToString#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/cs/roundtripex2.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Double.ToString#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Double.ToString/vb/roundtripex2.vb#6)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载区别通过返回一个布尔值，该值指示是否分析操作成功，而不是返回的已分析的数字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 不必使用异常处理来测试是否的事件中`s`无效，无法成功分析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`参数可以包含当前区域性的， ， （字符串比较是区分大小写） 或格式的字符串：The `s` parameter can contain the current culture's , , (the string comparison is case-sensitive), or a string of the form: [ws][sign][integral-digits,]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][ws][ws][sign][integral-digits,]integral-digits[.[fractional-digits]][e[sign]exponential-digits][ws] 括号中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|一系列的空白字符。A series of white-space characters.| |*sign**sign*|负号或正号符号。A negative sign or positive sign symbol.| |*整型数字**integral-digits*|一系列数字字符，范围从 0 到 9 的指定数的整数部分。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the integral part of the number. 整型数字可以是 absent 是否存在小数位数。Integral-digits can be absent if there are fractional-digits.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的组分隔符符号。A culture-specific group separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|一系列数字字符，范围从 0 到 9 的指定数的小数部分。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify the fractional part of the number.| |*E**E*|一个大写或小写字符 e 指示指数 （科学型） 表示法。An uppercase or lowercase character 'e', that indicates exponential (scientific) notation.| |*指数数字**exponential-digits*|一系列数字字符，范围从 0 到 9 的指定指数。A series of numeric characters ranging from 0 to 9 that specify an exponent.| 有关数值格式的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about numeric formats, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). `s`参数被解释的结合使用和标志。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using a combination of the and flags. 这意味着该空白和千位分隔符可以但不是货币符号。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要显式定义的元素 (如货币符号、 千位分隔符和空白区域)，可出现在`s`，使用方法重载。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. `s`使用中的格式设置信息分析参数初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is parsed using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 为分析字符串使用的格式信息的一些其他指定区域性，请使用方法重载。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 通常，如果你通过方法通过调用创建的字符串方法时，原始返回值。Ordinarily, if you pass the method a string that is created by calling the method, the original value is returned. 但是，由于精度损失，值可能不相等。However, because of a loss of precision, the values may not be equal. 此外，尝试分析的字符串表示形式是或引发，如下面的示例所示。In addition, attempting to parse the string representation of either or throws an , as the following example illustrates.
